main event: A UFO sighting involving a bright light over Lambert Field on March 9, 1950, where a saucer-shaped craft landed, shot three beams northeast, and then took off.
interesting points: The object was described as being bright white and approximately 50 feet in diameter., The sighting lasted for 5 minutes., Witnesses reported that the craft landed and emitted three beams of light toward the northeast., The object had a level flight before disappearing in 2 to 3 seconds., The report concluded that it was not real or known aerial devices and cited insufficient information.
witness description: Members of the Berkeley Police Force, one a former Navy Air Force pilot, both on duty during the sighting.
